title: U.S.-Stock Funds Down 7.9% for 2022
sub_head: Reaction to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and worries about the Federal Reserve worsened the outlook for investment-grade bonds, too
body:
The rough start to 2022 continued for U.S. investors.
The average diversified U.S.-stock fund declined 1.3% in February—a month that started with concerns about the Federal Reserve and quickly shifted to Russia’s war on Ukraine. February’s decline pushed the year-to-date slide to 7.9%, according to Refinitiv Lipper data.
